title: Instructional Behavior Design Strategies to Improve Learning Efficiency in Vocational and Technical Education

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Simulating real vocational skills education classes in a simulated environment for pre-service and in-service teachers, with real-time observation, analysis, and evaluation of teaching behaviors using VR technology

learning_goals: Learners can apply indicators for evaluating the efficiency of vocational-technical education class time (average learning time effectiveness, learning effect per unit time) with 90% accuracy
Learners can analyze the impact of teaching behaviors’ frequency, cumulative time, and essential characteristics on learning efficiency and propose three or more improvement strategies
Learners can implement ‘questioning type’ teaching behaviors at a frequency of 80% or higher in a VR simulation environment to enhance learning effects per unit time

resources: Vocational and Technical Education Case Database

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
